problems.title: Check if String Contains Substring
problems.description:
Check if a given string contains a specific substring. Print "true" if the substring exists, otherwise print "false".

Input Format:
First line contains the main string.
Second line contains the substring to search for.

Output Format:
Print "true" if substring exists, otherwise print "false".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
Hello World
World

Sample Output
true

Sample Input
Java Programming
Python

Sample Output
false

Explanation:
"World" exists in "Hello World", so output is true.
problems.constraints:
1 <= length of main string <= 1000
1 <= length of substring <= 1000
hintsList: Use string search functions or iterate through the main string and check for substring match.

problems.title: Remove All Occurrences of a Character
problems.description:
Remove all occurrences of a specific character from a string and print the result.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.
Second line contains a character to remove.

Output Format:
Print the string after removing all occurrences of the character.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
programming
g

Sample Output
proarmin

Sample Input
hello world
o

Sample Output
hell wrld

Explanation:
Remove all occurrences of 'g' from "programming" to get "proarmin".
hintsList: Iterate through the string and build a new string excluding the character to remove.

problems.title: Sort Characters in String
problems.description:
Sort all characters in the string in alphabetical order (case-sensitive) and print the sorted string.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the string with characters sorted in alphabetical order.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
hello

Sample Output
ehllo

Sample Input
Programming

Sample Output
Paggimmnor

Explanation:
Sort characters: 'h', 'e', 'l', 'l', 'o' becomes 'e', 'h', 'l', 'l', 'o'.
hintsList: Convert string to character array, sort it, then join back into string.

problems.title: Find All Occurrences of Substring
problems.description:
Find and print the starting indices of all occurrences of a substring in a string. Print indices separated by spaces. If no occurrences found, print -1.

Input Format:
First line contains the main string.
Second line contains the substring to search for.

Output Format:
Print starting indices of all occurrences separated by spaces, or -1 if not found.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
abababab
abab

Sample Output
0 2 4

Sample Input
hello world
world

Sample Output
6

Sample Input
abc
def

Sample Output
-1

Explanation:
"abab" occurs at indices 0, 2, and 4 in "abababab".
problems.constraints:
1 <= length of main string <= 1000
1 <= length of substring <= 1000
hintsList: Use sliding window to check each position. For each starting position, check if substring matches.

problems.title: Longest Substring with At Most K Distinct Characters
problems.description:
Find the length of the longest substring that contains at most k distinct characters. Print the length.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.
Second line contains an integer k.

Output Format:
Print the length of longest substring with at most k distinct characters.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
abcabcbb
3

Sample Output
6

Sample Input
eceba
2

Sample Output
3

Explanation:
For "abcabcbb" with k=3, longest substring with at most 3 distinct characters is "abcabc" with length 6.
hintsList: Use sliding window with a hash map to track character frequencies. Expand right and contract left to maintain at most k distinct characters.

problems.title: Check if String is Rotated Palindrome
problems.description:
Check if any rotation of the given string is a palindrome. Print "true" if a rotation is palindrome, otherwise print "false".

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print "true" if any rotation is palindrome, otherwise print "false".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
baabc

Sample Output
true

Sample Input
abc

Sample Output
false

Explanation:
"baabc" rotated to "abcba" is a palindrome, so output is true.
hintsList: Concatenate string with itself. Check if any substring of length n (where n is original length) is a palindrome.

problems.title: Convert String to Lowercase
problems.description:
Convert all uppercase letters in the string to lowercase and print the result.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the string with all letters converted to lowercase.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
Hello World

Sample Output
hello world

Sample Input
JAVA PROGRAMMING

Sample Output
java programming

Explanation:
All uppercase letters are converted to lowercase.
hintsList: Iterate through each character. If it's an uppercase letter (A-Z), convert it to lowercase by adding 32 or using built-in functions.

problems.title: Print All Substrings
problems.description:
Print all unique substrings of the given string. Print each substring on a new line in lexicographical order. If a substring appears multiple times at different positions, print it only once.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print all unique substrings, each on a new line, in lexicographical order.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
abc

Sample Output
a
ab
abc
b
bc
c

Sample Input
ab

Sample Output
a
ab
b

Explanation:
Substrings of "abc" are: "a", "ab", "abc", "b", "bc", "c". Sorted lexicographically.

testCases.expectedOutput:
a
ab
abc
b
bc
c

e
es
est
s
st
t
te
tes
test

hintsList: Generate all substrings using nested loops, store them, sort lexicographically, then print.

problems.title: Minimum Insertions to Make Palindrome
problems.description:
Find the minimum number of insertions required to make a string a palindrome. Print the minimum number of insertions needed.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the minimum number of insertions required.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
ab

Sample Output
1

Sample Input
aba

Sample Output
0

Sample Input
abc

Sample Output
2

Explanation:
"ab" needs 1 insertion (can become "aba" or "bab"). "aba" is already palindrome, so 0 insertions.
hintsList: Find the longest palindromic subsequence (LPS). Minimum insertions = length of string - length of LPS.

problems.title: Longest Repeated Substring
problems.description:
Find the longest substring that appears at least twice in the given string (non-overlapping occurrences allowed). Print the substring. If multiple substrings have the same maximum length, print the first one. If no repeated substring exists, print empty string.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the longest repeated substring, or empty string if none exists.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
banana

Sample Output
ana

Sample Input
abc

Sample Output


Sample Input
aaaa

Sample Output
aaa

Explanation:
In "banana", "ana" appears twice at positions 1-3 and 3-5, so it's the longest repeated substring.
hintsList: Generate all substrings and check which ones appear at least twice. Keep track of the longest one.
